Open thy doors, O Lebanon, that the fire may devour thy cedars.

Howl, fir tree; for the cedar is fallen; because the mighty are spoiled: howl, O ye oaks of Bashan; for the forest of the vintage is come down.<RF>mighty: or, gallants<Rf><RF>the forest…: or, the defenced forest<Rf>
<FI>There is<Fi> a voice of the howling of the shepherds; for their glory is spoiled: a voice of the roaring of young lions; for the pride of Jordan is spoiled.<CM>
Thus saith the LORD my God; Feed the flock of the slaughter;
Whose possessors slay them, and hold themselves not guilty: and they that sell them say, Blessed <FI>be<Fi> the LORD; for I am rich: and their own shepherds pity them not.

For I will no more pity the inhabitants of the land, saith the LORD: but, lo, I will deliver the men every one into his neighbour's hand, and into the hand of his king: and they shall smite the land, and out of their hand I will not deliver <FI>them<Fi>.<RF>deliver: Heb. make to be found<Rf>

And I will feed the flock of slaughter, <FI>even<Fi> you, O poor of the flock. And I took unto me two staves; the one I called Beauty, and the other I called Bands; and I fed the flock.<RF>even…: or, verily the poor<Rf><RF>Bands: or, Binders<Rf>
Three shepherds also I cut off in one month; and my soul lothed them, and their soul also abhorred me.<RF>lothed…: Heb. was straightened for them<Rf>

Then said I, I will not feed you: that that dieth, let it die; and that that is to be cut off, let it be cut off; and let the rest eat every one the flesh of another.<RF>another: Heb. his fellow, or, neighbour<Rf>
And I took my staff, <FI>even<Fi> Beauty, and cut it asunder, that I might break my covenant which I had made with all the people.
And it was broken in that day: and so the poor of the flock that waited upon me knew that it <FI>was<Fi> the word of the LORD.<RF>so…: or, the poor of the flock, etc. certainly knew<Rf>
And I said unto them, If ye think good, give <FI>me<Fi> my price; and if not, forbear. So they weighed for my price thirty <FI>pieces<Fi> of silver.<RF>If ye…: Heb. If it be good in your eyes<Rf>
And the LORD said unto me, Cast it unto the potter: a goodly price that I was prised at of them. And I took the thirty <FI>pieces<Fi> of silver, and cast them to the potter in the house of the LORD.
Then I cut asunder mine other staff, <FI>even<Fi> Bands, that I might break the brotherhood between Judah and Israel.<RF>Bands: or, Binders<Rf><CM>
And the LORD said unto me, Take unto thee yet the instruments of a foolish shepherd.

For, lo, I will raise up a shepherd in the land, <FI>which<Fi> shall not visit those that be cut off, neither shall seek the young one, nor heal that that is broken, nor feed that that standeth still: but he shall eat the flesh of the fat, and tear their claws in pieces.<RF>cut off: or, hidden<Rf><RF>feed: or, bear<Rf>
Woe to the idol shepherd that leaveth the flock! the sword <FI>shall be<Fi> upon his arm, and upon his right eye: his arm shall be clean dried up, and his right eye shall be utterly darkened.<CM>
